layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: Get measurably better at what matters.

questions.text: My ability to accurately identify what I'm feeling is ...

answers.4: good — I have vocabulary and awareness for most emotional states
answers.5: sharp — I can name what I'm feeling with precision
answers.2: basic — I can identify strong emotions but miss subtler ones
answers.3: developing — I'm getting better but still miss a lot
answers.1: poor — I often don't know what I feel

questions.text: My ability to read others' emotional states is ...

answers.4: good — I can usually tell what's going on with people
answers.5: strong — I pick up emotional signals others miss
answers.2: basic — I catch obvious signals but miss subtle ones
answers.3: developing — I read some people well, others not at all
answers.1: poor — I'm often blindsided by others' emotions

questions.text: My techniques for regulating strong emotions are ...

answers.4: practical — I have tested methods that actually work
answers.5: refined — I know exactly what works for me in different situations
answers.2: theoretical — I know ideas but they don't work for me
answers.3: developing — some techniques work, others don't
answers.1: nonexistent — I'm at the mercy of my emotions

questions.text: My skill in having difficult emotional conversations is ...
questions.principle: Difficult conversations are a learnable skill

answers.4: good — I can navigate conflict and vulnerability productively
answers.5: strong — I can guide difficult conversations to good outcomes
answers.2: basic — I can have them but they often go badly
answers.3: developing — some go well, others blow up
answers.1: poor — I avoid them or make them worse

questions.text: My understanding of how thoughts and beliefs affect emotions is ...
questions.principle: Cognitive-emotional connection can be leveraged skillfully

answers.4: good — I can usually trace emotions to beliefs and work there
answers.5: deep — I understand the connection and use it effectively
answers.2: basic — I know there's a connection but can't use it
answers.3: developing — I sometimes work at the cognitive level to affect emotions
answers.1: absent — I see them as separate
